posts.author: Ylaern
posts.content:
Hi guys,

Looking to play my first cleric in a custom environment and i'd like some pointers. The Thay PW has some modifications to spells which i'll list.
I'm after a cleric PvM build, preferably with the animal/plant domain. the max level on the server is 25. I'd like it to be Elf or Human, either down the zen archery or melee route, whichever is going to give me the easiest time up to level 10 where most characters float.
 
Spell and Class changes:
Ability buffs are a flat +4 and last 1 minute/level.
Improved Invis is 1 round/level.
Magic Vestment is 2 minute/level
All summons are also 2 minute/level.

Shifter gains wildshape 2/3/4 at levels 2/3/4 respectively, humanoid at 5 and toned-down versions of undead/construct/dragon shape at 6/7/8. 

Realistically the max item enhancement is +4, there is no penalty for multiclassing. As an interesting aside there is the potential for 9th level clerics to become shifters, i'd be curious to see what you guys think about a cleric/shifter/monk split? I see its asking a lot for 25 levels though. Thanks for your time.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I can think of several approaches:
Pure Cleric so you can be effective casting offensively as well as buffing.
Fighter 2 and the rest Cleric, so you get free Martial Weapons Proficiency and 2 more feats.
Fighter 4 and the rest Cleric, so you can also get Weapon Spec and Epic Weapon Spec, but not until level 24, which is why I also suggested only 2 Fighter.
Monk 2, Fighter 2 or 0, and the rest Cleric. You get your WIS bonus added to your AC and you get the Monk attack progression on your kama. Definitely add the Fighter levels if you want to wield 2 kamas instead of just 1.

posts.author: Ylaern
posts.content: If I took the pure cleric route and picked up extend, empower and still or silent spell, a long with expertise mode and weapon focus in longsword and blind fight, would you just pump as much wis as possible? I'm not sure how to distribute stats between strength and wis considering I'll be using divine power when in melee

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
From what you said about focusing in longsword, I take it your wanting a melee cleric.  So the real question then is how loaded down do you want to be in between castings of divine power/favor.

A str of 14 lets you carry 116 lbs while a 16 lets you carry 153.

Full plate weighs 50 lbs and a tower shield weights 45.  Thats 95 lbs for plain common gear.  Some magical or rare materials lower the base weight.

So if strength enhancing items are common, you might be able to get away with a 14 str.  Or if bags of holding are easy to come by, then you may be able to go lower still.

Myself, I'd probably go with 16 just to give you some leeway in carrying stuff without having to make sure you were always buffed.

I'm sure Valefor or Max will come by sooner or later and give you some better info.
